news_header: Mayor Jari Rantapelkonen emphasizes the importance of showcasing research in Sodankylä through the planned Science Centre Aurora, focusing on the Northern Lights and related studies.
news_text: Jari Rantapelkonen, the Mayor of Sodankylä, highlights the significance of publicly presenting excellent research in the municipality. A science centre dedicated to space and soil research, named Science Centre Aurora, is being designed, with a focus on the Northern Lights. The mayor believes that showcasing international aurora research will enhance tourism and that mining activities should also be featured. The project has garnered significant interest, with extensive cooperation from universities, science centres, and mining companies. An external contractor will manage the construction, with an estimated budget of EUR 3 million sourced from grants, EU funding, and loans. The Observatory of Geophysics in Sodankylä will play a key role in content creation for the centre, aiming to make scientific information accessible to the public. The implementation of the Science Centre Aurora is projected for 2028-2029.
